summary: This document is an agenda and attendance list for a victim briefing held by the FBI's Victim Services Division in Miramar, Florida on October 15, 2019, as part of the Epstein investigation. It details the schedule, attendees, and notes that 17 people attended representing 9 victims, with some victims represented by attorneys.

persons.name: Robert C. Joffe
persons.context: Listed as an attorney representing victims at the Miami victim briefing.

persons.name: Bradley Edwards
persons.context: Listed as an attorney representing victims at the Miami victim briefing.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Listed as an attorney representing victims at the Miami victim briefing.

connections.description: Both are listed as attorneys representing victims at the same briefing, suggesting they are part of the legal representation for victims in the Epstein case.
Listed together as attorneys representing victims, indicating they are colleagues or co-counsel.

events.title: Miami Victim Briefing
events.description: A briefing organized by the FBI's Victim Services Division for victims of the Epstein investigation, held in Miramar, Florida. The agenda included opening remarks, introductions, legal process explanations, media engagement, victim rights, and open discussion.

events.title: VSD Staff Meeting
events.description: Victim Services Division staff meeting at the Miami Field Office to complete last-minute tasks in preparation for the victim briefing.

events.title: Scheduled Victim Interviews
events.description: Victim interviews were scheduled to take place at the Miami Field Office following the briefing.

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division held a victim briefing in Miramar, FL on October 15, 2019, as part of the Epstein investigation (NY-3027571).
17 people attended the briefing, representing 9 victims, with 5 support guests and 3 attorneys present.
Attorneys Robert C. Joffe, Bradley Edwards, and Brittany Henderson were listed as representing victims at the briefing.
The agenda included sessions on prosecutions, media engagement, victim rights, and open discussion, indicating an organized effort to inform and support victims.
Victim interviews were scheduled for October 16, 2019, at the Miami Field Office, showing ongoing investigative activity.
